intro: Pedicularis hirtella, commonly known as the hairy monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
